description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b5ahf","text":"This protocol provides guidelines to perform dual antibody immunohistochemistry ( IHC) on standard FFPE tissue in the Sean C. Bendall and Michael R. Angelo labs. The staining procedure is principally performed to validate the co-occurrence of two targets observed in Multiplex Ion Beam Imaging Time of Flight (MIBI_TOF) analysis. \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP) Method Development Community

keywords: chromogenic, double stain, immunohistochemistry, IHC, multiplex,dual antibody

protocol_references: {"blocks":[{"key":"1b94s","text":"This protocol refers to detailed procedures found in these respective Protocol IO: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"et4ju","text":"IHC staining dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bf6ajrae","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":41}],"data":{}},{"key":"7cmp5","text":"Sequenza dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bmc6k2ze","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":9,"length":41}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ic9p","text":"MIBI and IHC solutions dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bmc6k2ze","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":23,"length":41}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2A6ACB3BC91211ED97C90A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bf6ajrae"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2A6ACBC2C91211ED97C90A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bmc6k2ze"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"2A6ACC33C91211ED97C90A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bmc6k2ze"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a6rcu","text":"This protocol refers to detailed procedures found in these respective Protocol IO: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfs90","text":"IHC staining dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bf6ajrae","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":13,"length":41}],"data":{}},{"key":"bndbc","text":"Sequenza dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bmc6k2ze","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":9,"length":41}],"data":{}},{"key":"7n2eh","text":"MIBI and IHC solutions dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bmc6k2ze","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":23,"length":41}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"60A636E5C74811EDA5DC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bf6ajrae"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7B56F452C74811EDA5DC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bmc6k2ze"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"543EC3C2C74811EDA5DC0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bmc6k2ze"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"frehf","text":"Slides are baked, deparaffinized and processed for antigen retrieval and washed in PBS wash buffer as described in the IHC staining protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fhdup","text":"To block endogenous peroxidase and alkaline phosphatase, the section of each slide is covered with 3-4 drops of Bloxall (Vector Laboratories, SP-6000-100), and incubated for 30 min at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fvj4r","text":"The slides are then placed in an immunostain humid chamber.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ukvg","text":"After blocking, the slides are briefly rinsed with PBS wash buffer and mounted on the Sequenza assembly  (ref. Sequenza protocol).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2lb36","text":"Add 2 mL of PBS wash buffer for each slide and let the entire volume of buffer flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1guja","text":"Add 200 µL of blocking buffer (ref. MIBI IHC solutions) and incubate 1h.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5ftgj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dirgd","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aha5o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0qvi","text":"Perform an antibody titration for each antigen target. The recommended starting titers would be 1 µg/mL and 0.25  µg/mL with known antibody concentration or use the provider recommended dilution titer and 4x less (e.g. 1:400 and 1:1600). From the results of the first titration, iterate with a second titration to narrow it down. This initial titration can be done using the HRP and DAB detection. The DAB revelation time should be between 30s to 1 min, no less.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75tfa","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7iiu4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"a5p8i","text":"The ImpressDuet (Vector Laboratories) requires the use of a mouse IgG antibody for the antigen A and a rabbit IgG antibody for the antigen B. A version of ImpressDuet kit (Vector Laboratories, MP-7714) uses a secondary antibody anti-mouse conjugated with alkaline phosphatase (AP) and an anti-rabbit conjugated with peroxidase (HRP). The ImpressDuet kit (Vector Laboratories, MP-7724) offers the reciprocal with an secondary antibody anti-mouse conjugated with HRP and an anti-rabbit conjugated with AP.  The kits also includes a brown substrate for HRP and magenta substrate for AP. These kits are designed to obtain reliable results on tissue sections where the two target antigens do not over-lap (co-localize) in the same structure of the same cell, but rather are expressed in different cell compartments or different cell types. One may choose the substrate combination empirically that offers the best contrast between the two antigens of interest. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"atf51","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2289m","text":"DAB chromogenic reaction is revealed by a brown coloration in positive areas.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c0v2r","text":"Rapid brown appearance (\u003c15s) after adding the DAB indicates an over titration of the primary antibody.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"alm8h","text":"Light brown or no coloration \u003e1 min reveals is undertitered primary antibody or negative result.\nRevealing time should be set constant at 40s but can be extented up to 1 min max.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":104,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"8smbj","text":"Optimal titer at constant development time ensure consistency when large number of slides are processed.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5du9n","text":"Once the initial titer is determined, perform a single color stain for each target with each substrate. Choose the color substrate that gives the best sensitivity for a putative target. In contrast to DAB, some substrates have a wide range of development time which gives more flexibility to increase sensitivity. For example, the alkaline phosphatase substrate Vector blue (SK-5300) has an optimal revelation time of 20-30 min but can be extended from 2 to 4 hours. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7m8mj","text":"Once the secondary-enzyme conjugate, the color substrate, and the development time for each antigen target have been determined, proceed to perform the double staining.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ab5ii","text":"Dilute the antibody with the lowest titer first (Antibody 1) in antibody diluent buffer. Then dilute the second antibody (Antibody 2) using the solution of Antibody 1 with the lower titer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9gm46","text":"After blocking, add 200 µL antibody diluent and let the entire volume of buffer flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73uui","text":"Add 100 µL of the diluted antibodies per slide and incubate at 4°C overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"925ck","text":"The next day, add 2 mL of PBS wash buffer and let the entire volume of buffer flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fknvm","text":"For each slide, add 3 drops of the secondary antibody-enzyme mix corresponding the desired color for each target (ImpressDuet, MP-7714 or MP-7724, Vector Laboratories).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8prij","text":"Incubate for 10 min at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"56iqv","text":"Add 2 mL of PBS wash buffer and let the entire volume of buffer flow through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ffoa0","text":"Bring all the reagents for double IHC staining to room temperature. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5vgjn","text":"Start revealing with the alkaline phosphatase substrate first.  Prepare the alkaline phosphatase substrate working solution by adding the components in the recommended buffer as instructed by the manufacturer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3of1u","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2unh7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"caoda","text":"As an example, Vector Blue alkaline phosphatase substrate recommended buffer is 100mM Tris-HCl pH 8.2-8.5 , 0.1% Tween for antigen retrieved tissue section. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"acn49","text":"Dismount the Sequenza assembly and put the slides on a immunostain humid chamber.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Add immediately an excess of substrate working solution to cover the tissue section.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 . ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71luc","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fo2bs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"3o96a","text":"Some substrates may develop better in the dark. Put the immunostain humid chamber cover during development.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7v20m","text":"Stop the development by removing the excess and incubate for 5 min in recommended buffer (100 mM Tris-HCl pH 8.5, Tween 0.1% or PBS). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fo5jp","text":"Rinse in water prior to the peroxidase development.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f4ubk","text":"Prepare the peroxidase substrate working solution by adding the components in the recommended buffer as instructed by the manufacturer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2no0e","text":"Put the slides back into the immunostain humid chamber. Immediately add an excess of the peroxidase substrate working solution to cover the tissue section and develop for 40s.       ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6g0ff","text":"Stop the development by removing the excess and transfer in water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4dmk8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27urh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fglrh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6in9","text":"It is not recommended to counterstain with hematoxylin. Some substrates are partially soluble in xylene. Do use xylene-based mounting medium.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3a96c","text":"Dehydrate the tissue in 1x ethanol 70%, 1x ethanol 80%, 2x ethanol 95%, 2x ethanol 100%.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2ubm4","text":"Coverslip in a non-aqueous mounting media such as VectaMount (Vector Laboratories, H-5000).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqako","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8i9fq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"144vg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cf6mu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"18cf5","text":"Slides can be placed in a 70°C oven for 1h to accelerate drying.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8r4ue","text":"Let the slides dry completely before visualization.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Dual antibody immunohistochemistry staining
